result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashanti Malki Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: - Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 9/8/22. if released from custody in time.

miscConds.notes: - Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete batterer's intervention program. 
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications. 
- Third party contact for the purpose of the time with children. 
- DV assessment imposed.

- No contact with the victim which rises to the level of probable cause. 
- No contact with firearms.
- Court will allow for expungement upon the successful completion of probation.

- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation. 
- Court set restitution at zero. 
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. 
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. 
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply the remaining balance to be returned to the poster. 
- Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashanti Malki Thomas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ashanti Malki Thomas in court, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court for Ashanti Malki Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Complete 25 hours of community service.
- No contact with victim which rises to the level of probable cause.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children. 
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- DV assessment imposed.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 9/8/22, if released from custody in time.
*Court will allow for expungement upon the successful completion of probation.

Received and filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed. ADDENDUM TO PLEA QUESTIONAIRE AND WAIVER OF RIGHTS

Court further converts the 09/06/2022 jury trial date to a plea/sentencing hearing. Case adjourned to Br 29.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  Limited curfew from 6pm to 7am. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $2,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TJJ

Defendant Ashanti Malki Thomas in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Ashanti Malki Thomas in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashanti Malki Thomas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
